tool_description: Build your own sensor application.  Ubidots simplifies the making of Internet of Things applications for data capturing, real-time remote monitoring and getting insights from sensor data.
name: Ubidots
title: Ubidots

api_list.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_list.description: This resource list the variables of a specified data source, showing all the fields of the variables.

api_list.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}
api_list.description: This resource returns a variable and its details. It shows additional fields than the ones required during the creation of the variable:  last_value: Shows the last value written to the variable.

utterances.utterance: Can you retrieve the details for the variable with ID 'temp_sensor_1'?

Can you fetch the last value for the variable 'vibration_sensor_8'?

I need the last value recorded for the variable 'water_level_sensor_10'.

api_list.name: GET /variables
api_list.description: Retrieves the list of all the variables owned by a user. The header X-Auth-Token is needed to have the permissions for this endpoint.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/variables"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/variables"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET /datasources
api_list.description: This resource lists all the existing data sources of a user.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/datasources"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: GET /datasources/{datasource_id}
api_list.description: This resource obtains an existing data source and its details. Also, it returns additional fields besides the ones required during the creation of the data source:  number_of_variables: Shows the number of variables contained by the data source. last_activity: Returns the date of the last activity

api_list.name: GET /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_list.description: This resource returns the values of the specified variable.  Every value will have a timestamp which is a value in milliseconds according to the POSIX standard.

api_list.name: POST /variables/{variable_id}/values
api_list.description: This resource creates a new value within the specified variable. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.

utterances.utterance: Add a new value to the variable with ID 'temperature_sensor_1'.
Create a new data point for the variable 'humidity_sensor_2'.
Record a new value for the variable 'pressure_sensor_3'.
Insert a new value into the variable 'light_sensor_4'.
Add a new data entry for the variable 'motion_sensor_5'.
Create a new value for the variable 'co2_sensor_6'.
Record a new data point for the variable 'noise_sensor_7'.
Insert a new value into the variable 'vibration_sensor_8'.
Add a new data entry for the variable 'wind_speed_sensor_9'.

api_list.name: POST /datasources
api_list.description: This resource creates a new data source. Every data source owns a number of variables, and has a context with different attributes. For example, a data source called “Delivery Truck” can have a attributes like {“City”: “Boston”} or {“Type”: “Truck”}.  Attributes are not meant to change dynamically over time, but to add a “relational” layer to your data sources.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/datasources"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/datasources"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: POST /datasources/{datasource_id}/variables
api_list.description: This resource creates a new variable within the specified data source. You can assign tags to variables (i.e. “room”, “yard”), and also properties with atributes, for example: {“Color”: “Blue”} or {“Status”: “OFF”}

api_list.name: POST /collections/values
api_list.description: This resource allow the create a value for multiple variables. Every value has a timestamp that can be either specified manually by the device, or automatically by the server.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com/collections/values"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "community-ubidots.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
